data: roads of Sussex | Turnpike | Lewes-Beachbourne road | northern scarp of the Downs

An old-fashioned carrierâ€™s cart, such as you may still meet on the roads of Sussex, tilted, one-horsed, and moving at the leisurely pace of a bye-gone age, turned East at the Turnpike, and made slowly along the Lewes-Beachbourne road under the northern scarp of the Downs one evening of autumn in 1908.
One Woman: Being the Second Part of a Romance of Sussex
